page.title: 04Caverswall Castle
page.content: The restored Castle never remained in the same family for more than two or three generations.In 1811 a group of Benedictine Nuns took up residence and remained until 1850.In 1890 the Castle was bought by Mr W E Bowers and many improvements were made including a new east wing.In 1932 the Castle was once again sold to a society of nuns who remained in occupation until 1977.The Castle was then sold for 30000 pounds and divided between several families so that today it remains a desirable family residential block.
